job_description:
Introduction

Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd is seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead an enterprise-grade digital payment platform. This role will define product strategy, drive go-to-market execution, and own business outcomes for payment capabilities supporting automobile-related services such as emergency roadside assistance, vehicle insurance, and other vehicle owner services. The ideal candidate must have deep expertise in digital payments, wallet integrations, and partner ecosystems.

Responsibilities

  • Own the end-to-end lifecycle of the digital payment platform, including strategy, roadmap, launch, and continuous optimization
  • Define and execute the payments product vision, roadmap, and KPIs aligned with enterprise business objectives
  • Lead integration of payment gateways, digital wallets, alternative payment methods, and emerging payment technologies
  • Own partner integrations with external payment providers, banks, wallet providers, insurers, and service partners
  • Drive go-to-market strategy for payment capabilities, including pricing, monetization, and adoption
  • Ensure scalable, secure, and highly available payment processing across multiple service offerings
  • Partner with engineering, architecture, security, and compliance teams to meet regulatory and industry standards (PCI-DSS, data privacy, fraud prevention)
  • Collaborate with automobile service teams to embed seamless payment experiences into roadside assistance, insurance, and vehicle owner journeys
  • Use customer, transaction, and performance data to drive continuous improvement and reduce payment friction and failures

Required Qualifications

  • 8+ years of product management experience, with significant focus on digital payments or fintech platforms
  • Strong hands-on experience with payment gateways, processors, digital wallets, and payment orchestration
  • Experience integrating third-party partners such as banks, wallet providers, insurers, and mobility service providers
  • Strong understanding of payment flows, settlement, reconciliation, chargebacks, and fraud management
  • Solid business and financial acumen with experience driving revenue, margins, and platform adoption
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in automotive, mobility services, insurance, or adjacent industries
  • Experience owning payment products from concept through go-to-market in the US
  • Experience working in regulated and high-availability enterprise environments
  • Familiarity with US payment ecosystems and compliance requirements

Contact Information

Interested candidates should email their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current, and expected CTC details. Important Notice: Reflections Info Systems does not charge any fees for job applications. All communications are conducted via the official website or LinkedIn, and employment-related emails are sent from Careers@reflectionsinfos.com. For any clarifications or alerts regarding potential fraud, contact the same email address.
summary: Senior Product Manager to lead a digital payment platform for automobile services, integrating payment solutions and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.

job_description:

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: www.reflectionsglobal.com Closing Date: 09, Jan 2026 Published: 02, Jan 2026 Contact: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Introduction

We are seeking a Senior .NET Developer with 8+ years of experience in .NET Core and Microsoft Azure to design, develop, and maintain scalable, high-performance enterprise applications. This role demands strong technical ownership, architectural depth, and effective collaboration within an Agile/Scrum environment.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, enhance, document, and maintain applications using .NET Core 6/8+, C#, REST APIs, and MS SQL Server
  • Build and maintain cloud-native solutions on Microsoft Azure
  • Develop and consume RESTful APIs and integrate with third-party systems
  • Implement Microservices and SOA-based architectures
  • Apply Clean Architecture, DDD, and CQRS patterns for scalable solutions
  • Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies, sprint planning, and Jira-based tracking
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize applications with a focus on performance, reliability, and security
  • Write clean, reusable, testable, and efficient code
  • Support CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide technical guidance and mentorship

Preferred Skills

Primary Skills

  • Backend & Core Technologies: C#, .NET Core 6/8+, Entity Framework / EF Core, REST API development, MS SQL Server (complex queries, stored procedures, views/functions)

job_description:
About Us

Way.com — America’s dominant automotive super app, powering every mile for over 10 million customers—from auto insurance and parking to EV charging and more. Leveraging cutting-edge AI, machine learning, and advanced data analytics, we deliver innovative, personalized solutions that transform car ownership. Featured by Bloomberg and ranked 48th on Andreessen Horowitz’s Marketplace list of fastest-growing companies worldwide and recognized as the top Product in Insurance by UnitQ, we’re making car ownership easier, more affordable, and more rewarding.

Role Overview

We’re hiring a Lead Marketing Designer to work closely with the marketing and design leadership to shape how Way.com shows up visually, consistently, and at scale. This is not a pixel-pushing role.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead visual design across:
  • Marketing campaigns
  • Brand initiatives
  • Social and performance ads
  • Web and product-led marketing
  • Translate business and marketing goals into clear, high-impact visual stories
  • Own design quality end-to-end, from concept to final delivery
  • Collaborate with marketing, content, growth, and product teams
  • Maintain and evolve brand consistency while pushing creative boundaries
  • Mentor junior designers and raise the overall bar of the team
  • Manage multiple projects without compromising quality or timelines

You won’t just execute briefs. You’ll shape how marketing design operates.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 4–6 years of experience in graphic / marketing design
  • Strong portfolio that shows thinking, not just visuals
  • Expert-level proficiency in Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Ability to leverage AI for:
  • Faster concept generation and creative exploration
  • Campaign variations at scale
  • Improving speed without compromising brand quality
  • Train juniors on the usage of AI in ideation and design execution
  • Experience designing for digital-first brands and fast-moving teams
  • Ability to take feedback, push back when needed, and defend design decisions
  • Comfort with ambiguity and rapid iteration
  • High ownership mindset. You treat the work like it’s your brand.

Bonus (Not Mandatory, But Valuable):

  • Motion, video, or basic animation skills
  • Understanding of performance marketing creatives
  • Experience in startup or high-growth environments

Why This Role Matters

Design at Way.com is not a support function. It’s a growth lever. You’ll be working on marketing design that supports and scales:

  • Our large-scale app and web product
  • Marketing all the recent product initiatives (B2B - SaaS, B2C)
  • Brand initiatives and more.

You’ll have real ownership, direct feedback, and high expectations. If you enjoy clarity, accountability, and building work that actually moves the needle, this role will fit.

Why You Will Love Working With Us

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Opportunity to make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.

Contact Email: careers@way.com Apply Now: https://waydot.greythr.com/hire/jobs/lead-graphic-designer
summary: Lead Marketing Designer to shape Way.com's visual identity, driving campaigns and mentoring teams. Utilize AI and design tools to enhance brand impact in a fast-paced tech environment.
